Content: And it's yours for the taking.

Heading: Study with us
Content: From our friendly academics, to our beautiful campus, and our superb facilities, there are more reasons than ever to choose Hull.

Open Day
Content: 9.00 - 16.00 Reserve your space

Heading: Where success begins
Content: Awarded gold for the highest standard of teaching in the Teaching Excellence Framework (TEF) . Named in the top 50 UK institutions for research power by the Times Higher Education. 95% of students are in work or further study fifteen months after graduating. 1

Heading: Life-changing research
Content: Our research has an impact globally, every single day. Join us in tackling the big issues – climate change, health inequalities, social injustice and more – and help us shape a fairer, brighter and carbon neutral future for all.

Heading: Hi there!
Content: Getting in touch with us has never been easier.

Heading: "I started University at 35 to pursue my dream of becoming a barrister"
"The time had come for me to get the education I wanted; I couldn't wait for my new adventure to begin"

We’ll help you make the right choice
Content: Find out everything you need to know about university - from course guides to accommodation - all from the comfort of your own home with our webinars.

Heading: Register for one of our upcoming webinars or virtual events
It’s Not Too Late to Apply to University
Postgraduate Education degrees at the University of Hull
Writing the Future – Creative Writing at Hull
Can we help you with anything else?
Applying to Hull
Content: Get a complete step-by-step guide on applying to university, including how to make the right choice for you, Live Chat for instant answers and advice, and specific advice for parents and carers. We’ll help you to get the place on the course you want.

Heading: Fees and finance
Content: Our online guide can take you through everything you need to know. From tuition fees and maintenance loans, to scholarships and childcare grants. And, of course, how to apply when the time comes.

Heading: Student support
Content: Whether it’s about money, your health or your studies, or you need pointing in the right career direction, you only have to ask. We won’t meddle, pry or preach, but we will do everything we can to help. Before you arrive, while you’re here, and even after you’ve left.

Heading: Ready to take your next step?
It’s time to find your extraordinary
We are Hull. And so are you.
Content: Study at a university where you can be you. You’ll feel welcome from day one and always connected and supported, so you can really make the most of your experience with us.

Heading: Watch an on-demand session for your subject now
Your student experience
Content: Of course, there’s a lot more to your time with us than the course you study.

Heading: This is where you’re meant to be
Content: The best way to find out if we’re the right choice for you is to come to one of our Open Days and see it all for yourself. It's your chance to imagine what your life as a student at Hull could be like.

Heading: You can also view sessions on demand right now
Accommodation
Content: With over 2,000 high quality rooms, all on campus, there’s a great range of accommodation options for you to choose from. And accommodation is guaranteed for all first years. 1

Heading: How to apply
Content: Applying to university can be a bit of a stressful business. Let us help you out, with top tips about what university admissions tutors are looking for when they’re assessing your application.

Heading: There’s no place like Hull
Content: From our beautiful campus to our friendly lecturers, there are loads of reasons to choose Hull. And with brilliant bars and restaurants, huge festivals and so much more, you’ll fall in love with our city, too.

Heading: Your next steps
Content: We’re here to help at every stage of your journey to university, whether you’re looking for a course, or you’re ready to apply. If you have any questions, just get in touch. You can also receive important updates from us using the form.

Heading: Footnotes
Content: All new students are guaranteed a single-person room within our University owned, managed or directed accommodation if you sign up by 1 October 2024. There is no on-campus provision for families and the University does not offer childcare.

All on-demand subject sessions

Heading: Hi there!
Content: Getting in touch with us has never been easier.

Heading: What do I need?
Content: When it comes to applying to university, you'll need a certain number of UCAS points. Different qualifications and grades are worth a different amount of points. For this course, you'll need…

Heading: What do I need?
Content: If you require a student visa to study or if your first language is not English you will be required to provide acceptable evidence of your English language proficiency level.

Heading: How do I pay for it?
How do I pay for it?
Take a look at our facilities
Health Campus
Content: Our home for the healthcare professionals of the future. Equipped with a simulated hospital ward, intensive care unit, resuscitation unit, and more.

Heading: Allam Medical Building
Content: The award winning Allam Medical Building is the centre of our Health Campus, packed with cutting edge features including mock hospital wards and operating theatres.

Heading: Microscopy Suite
Content: You could carry out research in our Microscopy Suite – an imaging facility for investigating the diagnosis of cancer and metabolic and cardiovascular diseases.

Heading: Future prospects
Content: A Diagnostic degree from Hull equips you with highly sought after skills and experience for a career in radiography in the NHS and beyond. And this accelerated course means that you'll be working with patients even sooner.

Heading: You may also be interested in…
Hi there!
Content: Getting in touch with us has never been easier.

Heading: Preparing for Learning in Higher Education
Content: This module is designed to give you the best possible start to your university studies, making sure you have all the essential skills you need to succeed. Through lectures and workshops we will teach you how to write in an academic style, how to find quality sources, how to reference work, culminating in writing up a mini-research project.

Heading: Introduction to Business
Content: Develop an understanding of a range of contemporary themes facing managers and the range of ethical dilemmas they pose. You will explore the managerial implications of issues like globalisation, international trade, demographic changes and sustainability developments.

Heading: Research in the Humanities, Social Sciences and Education
Content: This module will equip you with the necessary skills to conduct and analyse research in a specific interest, supported by academics within your subject. You'll navigate through the research process, from identifying an area of interest to presenting their findings to your peers.

Heading: Group Challenge (Humanities)
Content: Formulate and execute a group led enquiry into texts, cultural artifacts, film, music or dance. You'll explore their topics in groups at supervised workshops and develop questions on the cultural object relates to the living world of human experience, as well as developing your own methods to answer these questions.

Heading: Foundation in Data Analysis
Content: Develop a strong foundation in data collection and analysis. This module will introduce you to qualitative and quantitative data and how to analyse it; the collection of primary and secondary data; the production of high quality graphics; and report writing.

Heading: Academic Writing Skills
Content: Developing confidence in expression, oral as well as written, is a key feature of this module, which also aims to familiarise you with submission and assessment procedures in the context of Higher Education. This is a clear building block onto your degree programme and places you at a distinct advantage when you move into the following year.

Heading: Accounting and Finance
Content: Delve into topics such as financing decisions, cost behaviour, cost-volume-profit analysis, absorption costing, variance analysis and budgeting.

Heading: Developing Self & Others
Content: Assessing your human skills and developing good habits is central to your professional development. This module allows you to gain a better understanding of what is needed from the wider business perspective and apply theories of positive habit development in practice.

Heading: Introduction to Economics
Content: This introduction covers both microeconomics (the affairs of individual consumers, firms and government) and macroeconomics (the study of the economy as a whole).

Heading: Financial Accounting
Content: This module will provide you with introductory accounting knowledge covering basic double entry book-keeping, analysis and preparing a simple set of financial statements.

Heading: Introduction to Finance
Content: This module introduces you to the finance discipline. You'll explore the basic principles of finance, complemented with an analysis of case studies and examples from the finance news. There will be a special emphasis on ethical and sustainable finance.

Heading: Marketing
Content: Marketing is an exciting, dynamic, and creative environment to work in. It places brands in the consumers' mind and shapes their decisions. Marketing is a critical management function that is essential to business success. This module allows you to work with an organisation on a live marketing project based on a real-life challenge.

Heading: Financial Reporting
Content: This module covers the regulatory aspects of financial reporting. It will enable you to understand and evaluate financial statements according to international accounting standards.

Heading: Financial Management
Content: Explore the operational activities responsible for obtaining and ultilising the funds for efficient operations. This module will expose you to a wide range of important financial management tools, techniques, and underpinning theories relevant for decision-making in today's competitive financial environment.

Heading: Information Systems in Accounting and Finance
Content: In today’s highly competitive business environment, information is power – especially financial information. This module offers a broad insight into the role of accounting information systems and emerging technologies within the competitive business environment and explores how managers of business organisations use financial information to convey financial stability and performance.

Heading: Management Accounting
Content: Management account provides information to internal management for planning, organising and controlling organisational resources. Become familiar with concepts for calculating costs and prices of a product or service. You'll learn how to produce, analyse and articulate key information to an organisation's decision makers.

Heading: Financial Markets and Investment Banking
Content: Gain an understanding of modern financial markets and instruments. You'll learn to apply these concepts by following and interpreting current affairs in the financial markets. The module emphasises the role of investment banks, and the analysis is complemented with case studies and examples from the finance news.

Heading: Understanding Entrepreneurship
Content: Working with a local entrepreneurial firm, you'll get first-hand experience of exploring concepts around entrepreneurship. You'll gain insight into the real-life challenges and how local entrepreneurs overcome/negotiate those issues brining into play their individuality, commitment, and desire to make real change.

Heading: Disruptive and Emerging Technologies
Content: In this module, you'll have the flexibility to select a technology theme that you are excited about (e.g. cryptocurrencies, blockchain, artificial intelligence, augmented reality, etc.), and explore their management and socio-economic implications.

Heading: Sustainable Business and Innovation
Content: Develop insights into the major trends, challenges and innovative concepts relating to business sustainability and corporate responsibility.

Heading: Macroeconomics: Managing the Economy
Content: You’ll learn the ways that government policy affects the course of the economy through its influence on the rate of inflation, economic growth, and the level of employment.

Heading: Company Law
Content: Develop your understanding of the legal environment within which an accountant works, developing the ability to locate, extract and analyse data from multiple sources.

Heading: Summer School
Content: Broaden your experience in an international setting and study in one of our partner institutions for up to three weeks over the summer. This module can count towards your degree.

Heading: Advanced Financial Reporting and Theory
Content: Develop advanced knowledge of the role of financial reporting within the competitive business environment and explore how managers of business organisations use financial information to convey financial stability and performance.

Heading: International Finance
Content: Gain practical knowledge of foreign exchange markets, international monetary and financial theories, foreign exchange risk management and international investment strategies.

Heading: Advanced Management Accounting
Content: Building on the techniques of traditional management accounting, this module gives you the opportunity to reflect on the how and why in recent advances in management accounting theory and practice. In particular, the ways in which management accounting has to adapt to match changes in its environment and organisational context will be critically evaluated.

Heading: Current Issues in Financial Management
Content: Apply current finance theories to the analysis of ongoing issues in the financial market and the corporate world. You'll gain an appreciation of the social and political contexts of the international financial environment corporate organisations operate in.

Heading: Company Law
Content: Develop your understanding of the legal environment within which an accountant works, developing the ability to locate, extract and analyse data from multiple sources.

Heading: Macroeconomics: Managing the Economy
Content: You’ll learn the ways that government policy affects the course of the economy through its influence on the rate of inflation, economic growth, and the level of employment.

Heading: Auditing
Content: The module covers both the theoretical and procedural aspects of effective auditing. In particular, you'll explore standards of accountability and corporate behaviour in today's global market place; and monitoring the process of externally reporting financial information.

Heading: Quantitative Methods in Accounting and Finance
Content: Link theory with practical examples by analysing and modelling financial risk factors and other quantitative problems. You'll cover the learning outcomes highlighted in the Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) Institute Quantitative Methods syllabus at levels 1-3.

Heading: Summer School
Content: Broaden your experience in an international setting and study in one of our partner institutions for up to three weeks over the summer. This module can count towards your degree.

Heading: International Business
Content: Focus on the core concepts and practical applications of cross-border business activities. You'll explore the controversies and complexities surrounding international business issues.

Heading: Individual Research Project
Content: Engage in an academic study of a particular topic that is of interest to you over a sustained time, with elements of original work. You'll develop an advanced ability to locate, extract, analyse and interpret data from multiple sources.

Heading: Taxation
Content: This module is for those intending to study for a professional accountancy qualification after graduation, and may provide exemption from some of your professional exams.

Heading: What do I need?
Content: When it comes to applying to university, you'll need a certain number of UCAS points. Different qualifications and grades are worth a different amount of points. For this course, you'll need…

Heading: What do I need?
Content: If you require a student visa to study or if your first language is not English you will be required to provide acceptable evidence of your English language proficiency level.

Heading: How much is it?
Content: If you choose to study a year abroad, this costs £1,385 . If you want to spend a year in industry, this costs £1,850 .

Heading: How do I pay for it?
How much is it?
Content: 50% of full fee if you choose to study a year abroad. 20% of full fee if you want to spend a year in industry.

Heading: How do I pay for it?
Take a look at our facilities
Bloomberg Financial Markets Laboratory
Content: Our industry-standard suite offers simulated financial trading activities in real time. So you can practise trading in realistic scenarios before you do it for real.

Heading: Business Lounge
Content: A great space for you to meet with businesses, entrepreneurs and partners, laying the foundations for your future career. It’s an ideal spot to meet your course mates for group work, too.

Heading: Executive Education Suite
Content: Our Executive Education Suite offers bookable, fully AV equipped rooms where you can work on group projects and practise your presentation skills.

Heading: Allam Lecture Theatre
Content: The Business School has one of the largest lecture theatres on campus. As well as a fantastic environment for learning, it often plays host to outside speakers and special guests.

Heading: Future prospects
Content: You’ll open up a whole range of employment possibilities. Graduate roles include finance manager, chartered management accountant, financial analyst, external auditor, and bank manager. Or you could use the hands-on experience you gain throughout your degree to start your own business.

Heading: You may also be interested in…
BA (Hons) Business Management with Financial Management
Hi there!
